alert.note: Alert for Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 05 at 9:12PM MST until January 06 at 8:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up one to two inches. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...Larimer County below 6000 feet and Northwest Weld County. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 8 AM MST Thursday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 3 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Exposed skin may become quickly frostbitten or frozen. Plan on slippery road conditions. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. Roads will likely become slick and hazardous.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Larimer County Below 6000 Feet, Northwest Weld County
